content.title: Tag Type
content.content:
The `tag` type is a handy tool for categorizing and classifying documents.
Think of tags as **predefined categories** that you assign to your content.

It is one of the **parameterized field types** provided by the core module.

Example of a `tag` field definition:

```yaml
fields:
  - name: category
    label: Sponsor Tier Category
    type:
      name: tag
      params:
        values:
          - sponsor
          - partner
          - founding partner
```

The tag type supports the following parameters:

| Parameter | Type            | Mandatory | Description                                                                     |
|-----------|-----------------|-----------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| values    | list of strings | yes       | List of authorized tag values that can be assigned.                             |
| multiple  | boolean         | no        | Flag indicating whether a document can have multiple tags. Defaults to `false`. |
